name: John NORBERG v. Israel PEARLMAN d/b/a Sterling Shoe Store

parties: John NORBERG v. Israel PEARLMAN d/b/a Sterling Shoe Store.

opinions.text:
ORDER
The petition for writ of certiorari is denied.

attorneys: Dennis J. Roberts II, Atty. Gen., William G. Brody, Asst. Atty. Gen., Perry Shatkin, Chief Legal Officer, Taxation, Providence, for plaintiff-respondent.
Pearlman & Vogel, Thomas W. Pearlman, Providence, for defendant-petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
John NORBERG v. Israel PEARLMAN d/b/a Sterling Shoe Store.
No. 80-273-M.P.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
Aug. 28, 1980.
Dennis J. Roberts II, Atty. Gen., William G. Brody, Asst. Atty. Gen., Perry Shatkin, Chief Legal Officer, Taxation, Providence, for plaintiff-respondent.
Pearlman & Vogel, Thomas W. Pearlman, Providence, for defendant-petitioner.
